p: This article considers the challenges faced by clinical legal education (CLE) programmes in responding effectively to the COVID19 pandemic. With societies facing new risks that have prompted unprecedented change and upheaval, clinics face new sets of challenges and choices. They must respond to the new and accentuated service needs of clients while also safeguarding students and staff facing difficulties in adjusting to new circumstances. Clinics also need to fit with the responses of their universities and governments in terms of complying with social distancing requirements.
